s0001: Marquis Pingyang Cao Can was a native of Pei.
s0002: During Qin times he served as assistant jailer in Pei, while Xiao He was the chief clerk—they were both outstanding officials in the county.
s0003: When Gaozu rose as Duke of Pei, Cao Can followed as an attendant.
s0004: He led attacks on Huling and Fangyu, assaulting the Qin Inspector's army and greatly defeating it.
s0005: He advanced east to Xue, attacking the garrison of the Si River warden west of Xue's outer walls.
s0006: He attacked Huling again and captured it.
s0007: He was transferred to defend Fangyu.
s0008: Fangyu defected to Wei, so he attacked it.
s0009: Feng defected to Wei, so he attacked it.
s0010: He was granted the rank of Seventh Rank Noble.
s0011: He attacked the Qin Marshal Yi's army east of Dang, defeated it, and captured Dang, Hufu, and Qishanzhi.
s0012: He further attacked west from Xiayi to Yu, attacking Zhang Han's chariots and cavalry.
s0013: He attacked Yuanqi and Kangfu, being first to scale the walls.
s0014: He was promoted to Fifth Rank Noble.
s0015: He went north to rescue E, attacked Zhang Han's army, broke through their formations, and pursued to Puyang.
s0016: He attacked Dingtao and captured Linji.
s0017: He went south to rescue Yongqiu.
s0018: He attacked Li You's army, defeated it, killed Li You, and captured one Qin noble.
s0019: When Qin general Zhang Han defeated and killed Xiang Liang, the Duke of Pei and Xiang Yu led their armies east.
s0020: King Huai of Chu appointed the Duke of Pei as governor of Dang commandery to lead Dang commandery troops.
s0021: Thus he enfeoffed Cao Can as Holder of Silk, with the title Lord Jiancheng.
s0022: He was promoted to Duke of Qi, belonging to Dang commandery.
s0023: Afterwards he followed in attacking the Dongjun warden's army, defeating it south of Chengwu.
s0024: He attacked Wang Li's army south of Chengyang, then attacked it again at Gangli, greatly defeating it.
s0025: He pursued north, west to Kaifeng, attacked Zhao Ben's army, defeated it, and besieged Zhao Ben in Kaifeng city.
s0026: He attacked General Yang Xiong's army at Quyü to the west, defeated it, and captured one Qin marshal and one imperial secretary each.
s0027: He was promoted to Holder of Jade.
s0028: He followed in attacking Yangwu, captured Xuanyuan and Goushi, cut off the river crossings, returned to attack Zhao Ben's army north of Shi, and defeated it.
s0029: He followed south attacking Yan, fought with the Nanyang warden Yi east of Yangcheng's outer walls, broke through formations, captured Wan, captured Yi, and completely pacified Nanyang commandery.
s0030: He followed west attacking Wuguan and Yaoguan, capturing them.
s0031: He advanced attacking the Qin army south of Lantian, then at night attacked its north, the Qin army was greatly defeated, thus reaching Xianyang and destroying Qin.
s0032: When Xiang Yu arrived, he made the Duke of Pei King of Han.
s0033: The King of Han enfeoffed Cao Can as Marquis of Jiancheng.
s0034: He followed to Hanzhong, promoted to general.
s0035: He followed returning to pacify the Three Qins, initially attacking and capturing Bian, Gudao, Yong, and Lai.
s0036: He attacked Zhang Ping's army south of Haozhi, defeated it, besieged Haozhi, and captured Rangxiang.
s0037: He attacked the Three Qins army east of Rang and at Gaoque, defeating it.
s0038: He besieged Zhang Ping again, Zhang Ping fled from Haozhi.
s0039: He then attacked Zhao Ben and Grand Administrator Bao's army, defeating it.
s0040: He captured Xianyang to the east, renaming it New City.
s0041: Cao Can led troops guarding Jingling for twenty days, the Three Qins sent Zhang Ping and others to attack Cao Can, Cao Can sallied to attack, greatly defeating them.
s0042: He was granted fief income in Ningqin.
s0043: Cao Can as general led troops besieging Zhang Han at Fei Qiu.
s0044: As Commandant he followed the King of Han out of Linjin Pass.
s0045: Arriving in Hebei, he captured Xiuwu, crossed at Wei Jin, attacked Long Ju and Xiang Ta at Dingtao to the east, defeating them.
s0046: He captured Dang, Xiao, and Pengcheng to the east.
s0047: He attacked Xiang Yu's army, the Han army suffered great defeat and fled.
s0048: Cao Can as Commandant besieged and captured Yongqiu.
s0049: Wang Wu rebelled at Waihuang, Cheng Chu rebelled at Yan, he went to attack them, completely defeating both.
s0050: Marquis Zhutian rebelled at Yanshi, he advanced and defeated and captured Yanshi.
